result.execSummary:
The defendant Kent J Eisner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Harboring/Aiding a Felon (E/F/G/H/I or unclassified felony/not life), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.47(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall receive 2 days presentence credit if supervision is revoked

miscConds.notes: Must obtain/maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent
Shall have no contact or communication with Casey's General Store or Ross Goodinson
May petition the Court for expungment upon successful completion of supervision

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: Sentence shall commence on or before Court ordered start date;  with work release and transfer privileges

charges.descr: Harboring/Aiding a Felon (E/F/G/H/I or unclassified felony/not life)

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kent J Eisner in court with attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   An Amended Information is being filed. Victim's Rights is compliant.  The Court reviewed CPR and PQWOR and heard plea of Guilty to the Amended Charge of Harboring or Aiding a Felon.  Ct. found plea was given FKVI, accepted plea, and found Def guilty of Harboring or Aiding a Felon.  Court found factual basis for the original charge and for the reduction to the lower charge. The Court heard from State, Defense and Defendan'ts father, and sentenced as follows:  
S/W
Probation for 3 years with conditions:
30 days in the DCJail with H/T to comm. 6-1-2015 as a condition of probation 
No contact with Casey's General Store and no contact with Ross Goodinson 
File of $250 plus court costs
Any counseling as ordered by Agent 
DNA Sample/Surcharge 
Report to P&P by 4:00 pm on Monday, March 16, 2015 
He must be employed and/or in school full time 
Upon successful completion of probation, the defendant may apply for expungement, to be made part of the judgment 
2 days of presentence credit if revoked
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Court orders defendant in his home/residence from 6:00 pm to 6:00 am and may be allowed to leave without supervision from 6:00 am to 6:00pm; all other conditions of supervision shall remain

Defendant Kent J Eisner in court with attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 10 days mtns; stc set; parties heard on bail modification; Court orders defendant in his home/residence from 6:00 pm to 6:00 am and may be allowed to leave without supervision from 6:00 am to 6:00pm; all other conditions of supervision shall remain;  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Review hearing on December 10, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant, Kent J Eisner in court, James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant, defendant has not applied to the SPD office.  Court orders the defendant to go to the SPD office.  Court continues the prelim.  Sets another review hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Review hearing scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with ANK dob 8/17/1989.   Defendant shall not go on the premises at Casey's General Store, Beaver Dam WI.   Curfew:  Defendant shall be at his/her home unless at work/school, traveling directly to/from work/school, or in the immediate presence of a parent or guardian.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

1:17 - Defendant Kent J Eisner in court, in custody via video (refused SPD).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $1000 Cash bond  with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with ANK.   Defendant shall not go on the premises at Casey's General Store, Beaver Dam WI.   Curfew:  Defendant shall be at his/her home unless at work/school, traveling directly to/from work/school, or in the immediate presence of a parent or guardian.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Review hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.
